title: Neighbours describe the horror as father discovers two young daughters murdered in northern Perth
text:
Neighbours have described the horrific moment a father discovered his two young daughters had been killed.

The bodies of Tiana Djurasovic, six, and her elder sister Mia, 10, were discovered at their home in Bogdanich Way in Madeley, northern Perth on Friday at 5.30pm.

Their father Nenad Djurasovic had returned home from work to find one girl lying near the entrance and the other in the laundry.

Their mother Milka Djurasovic was then arrested at a nearby beach car park in the suburb of Kallaroo three hours later with self-inflicted wounds.

She was still under police guard in hospital on Saturday and has yet to be spoken to over the death of her daughters.

The deaths are currently being treated as suspicious and a forensic team will be going over the home for the next few weeks (forensic team at the scene)

A neighbour, whose daughter was best friends with Mia, said her father Nenad was in a state of shock, having made the discovery on Friday evening.

'His face was just white. He couldn't talk. His face was in shock,' the neighbour told The West Australian .

Another neighbours said the girls' grandparents on their mother's side were 'crying out in pain' while lying on the ground at the scene inconsolable.

'The girls’ grandfather, he got the call from Nenad telling him what has happened' he said explaining the horror that unfolded.

Bogdanich Way resident Didi Lee said her daughter Evania was 'best friends' with Mia who lived across the road from them.

'My daughter was crying, she could not sleep. I don’t know what to tell them,' she told the publication.

The bodies of Tiana and her elder sister Mia, 10, were discovered at the home in Madeley, northern Perth on Friday at about 5.30pm

According to WAtoday reports, neighbours called the police after hearing concerning screams coming from the house.

The family had lived in the home for more than 20 years, with the father working as an engineer and the mother as a nurse.

They reportedly kept to themselves and didn't interact with other families in the neighbourhood.

The girls were students at Ashdale Primary School where children will be offered counselling.

Investigators gather near the home where the bodies were found. Shocked residents on Bogdanich Way have described their disbelief at the Bosnian family's tragedy on the suburban street

Assistant Commissioner Paul Steel said the scene was quite 'complicated' and he was not aware as yet exactly who made the call to police.

The deaths are currently being treated as suspicious and a forensic team will be going over the home for the next few weeks.

Police have been outside the home where the bodies were found and the street has been blocked off while investigations are underway.

Assistant Commissioner Steel said inquiries indicate that the family was not known to police.

One neighbour whose daughter was best friends with Mia said the father Nenad Djurasovic was in a state of shock having made the discovery on Friday evening

'This is a tragic event and our heartfelt condolences go out to the friends and family of the children,' police said.

'Heart breaking events like this have an effect not only on those directly involved, the friends and family, but on the wider community of Western Australia.

'I can assure the people of Western Australia that the WA Police are doing all that they can to investigate this manner and to try and identify what it is that led to these tragic events,' they said.

The WA Police have asked anyone with information to contact Crime Stoppers.
description: The bodies of Tiana Djurasovic, six, and her elder sister Mia, 10, were found in Madeley, northern Perth on Friday at about 5.30pm. Their mother was later arrested at a nearby beach car park.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
